unnormalised: Okay, so you want to level up your game? Whether you're dreaming of hitting sixes like Virat Kohli or running marathons like Milind Soman, a solid training regimen is your secret weapon. It's not just about going to the gym and lifting heavy things randomly; it’s a carefully planned strategy to maximize your performance.
normalised: Okay, so you want to level up your game? Whether you're dreaming of hitting sixes like Virat Kohli or running marathons like Milind Soman, a solid training regimen is your secret weapon. It's not just about going to the gym and lifting heavy things randomly; it’s a carefully planned strategy to maximize your performance.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: remember that scene in "Chak De! India" where Kabir Khan drills those hockey players relentlessly? That's the essence of a good training regimen. It's focused, consistent, and pushes you beyond your comfort zone.
normalised: Think of it like this: remember that scene in "Chak De! India" where Kabir Khan drills those hockey players relentlessly? That's the essence of a good training regimen. It's focused, consistent, and pushes you beyond your comfort zone.

unnormalised: First up, you gotta figure out your goals. Are you aiming for the Mumbai Marathon? Or maybe trying out for the kabaddi team at IIT Delhi? Once you know your target, you can start building your program. This should include a mix of cardio, strength training, and flexibility exercises.
normalised: First up, you gotta figure out your goals. Are you aiming for the Mumbai Marathon? Or maybe trying out for the kabaddi team at I I T Delhi? Once you know your target, you can start building your program. This should include a mix of cardio, strength training, and flexibility exercises.

unnormalised: Cardio could be anything from running 5 km a day to cycling around Cubbon Park in Bangalore. Strength training might involve hitting the gym for weightlifting, focusing on compound movements like squats and deadlifts. Remember, proper form is key, otherwise you might end up nursing injuries instead of PBs. Don't be shy about asking for help from a qualified trainer at a local gym, even if it's just for a few sessions to nail down the technique.

Don't be shy about asking for help from a qualified trainer at a local gym, even if it's just for a few sessions to nail down the technique.

unnormalised: Flexibility is often overlooked, but it’s crucial for injury prevention and improving range of motion. Yoga, Pilates, or even simple stretching routines can work wonders. Imagine a cricketer like Ravindra Jadeja with no flexibility – impossible, right?
normalised: Flexibility is often overlooked, but it’s crucial for injury prevention and improving range of motion. Yoga, Pilates, or even simple stretching routines can work wonders. Imagine a cricketer like Ravindra Jadeja with no flexibility – impossible, right?

unnormalised: Recovery is just as important as the training itself. Make sure you’re getting enough sleep (at least 7-8 hours a night), and fuel your body with a balanced diet rich in protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Hydration is also crucial, especially in the scorching Indian heat. Think lots of water, coconut water, and even lassi!
normalised: Recovery is just as important as the training itself. Make sure you’re getting enough sleep (at least seven to eight hours a night), and fuel your body with a balanced diet rich in protein, carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Hydration is also crucial, especially in the scorching Indian heat. Think lots of water, coconut water, and even lassi!

unnormalised: Don't be afraid to adjust your regimen as you progress. What worked for you initially might not be as effective after a few weeks. Track your progress, listen to your body, and make tweaks as needed. Maybe you started with running 3 km and now you can easily do 8 km. Time to up the distance or add some interval training!
normalised: Don't be afraid to adjust your regimen as you progress. What worked for you initially might not be as effective after a few weeks. Track your progress, listen to your body, and make tweaks as needed. Maybe you started with running three kilometer and now you can easily do eight kilometer. Time to up the distance or add some interval training!

unnormalised: Finally, remember to stay motivated. Training can be tough, especially when you’re juggling work, family, and everything else life throws at you. Find a training buddy to keep you accountable, set realistic goals, and celebrate your achievements along the way. Even small victories, like shaving a few seconds off your 400m time, deserve recognition.

Find a training buddy to keep you accountable, set realistic goals, and celebrate your achievements along the way. Even small victories, like shaving a few seconds off your four hundred meter time, deserve recognition.

unnormalised: So, there you have it – the basics of building a solid training regimen. Now go out there and make it happen! Jai Hind!
